definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: We can see neither Altair or Ursa Major in the cloudy night sky.
sentences.chinese: 阴天的夜空既看不到牛郎星，也看不到北斗星。

sentences.english: During the day, it stopped to have a rest.
sentences.chinese: 白天，当它看不清北斗星的时候，它就停下来休息。

sentences.english: Many bright stars make the big Dipper.
sentences.chinese: 许多明亮的星星，形成北斗星。

sentences.english: Through courses of the sea rolling.
sentences.chinese: 船只循著北斗星探索起伏的海洋。

sentences.english: The Big Dipper pops out into your northwestern sky on August evenings.
sentences.chinese: 在八月的夜晚北斗星将移动至天空的西北方向。

sentences.english: On a fine summer night travellers can go by the Dipper.
sentences.chinese: 夏天晴夜，旅行的人可根据北斗星辨明方向。

sentences.english: You are the Big Dipper that guide us to move forward.
sentences.chinese: 春哥就像北斗星，指着我们向前走。

sentences.english: The camel walked forward by the direction of the dipper.
sentences.chinese: 每天夜里，骆驼向北斗星的方向慢慢地行走。

sentences.english: "I knew the North Star, " Henson wrote years later.
sentences.chinese: “我会认北斗星，”许多年后亨森写道。

sentences.english: One step at a time, business integrity is a business growth of the Big Dipper .
sentences.chinese: 一步一个脚印，商业诚信是企业成长的北斗星。

definition: Sirius, a double star in constellation Canis Major 大犬座
Great Bear/Big Dipper/Peitou town in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
many stars/a vast sky full of stars
